p: A total of 25 focus group discussions ( n = 200 participants), key informant interviews ( n = 87), and field notes were gathered from the 17 moderate- and high-risk districts in Uganda. Participants were sampled using a non-probability strategy, purposively selected based on cultural grouping and time spent in the community, with variable ages, gender, types of work, education levels and religion. Data was collected by the relevant research team in the local language or in English, depending on the lingua franca and participantâ€™s choice.
